resources.string: This app is already in the list

Uses Xposed Framework to hook the system EdgeEffect class.\n\nAllows injecting physics into all applications without system modification. If the module is not active in LSPosed, effects will only work in this app (demo mode).
Enables the built-in firmware physics implementation (Native).\n\nWorks directly through Pixel Parts system classes without hooks, ensuring maximum performance and compatibility.
Hooks cannot be installed.\n\nThe app did not detect an active LSPosed framework. Without it, intercepting system calls is impossible; settings will only apply within this application.

Distance multiplier during manual pulling (onPull).

• Value >= 1.0: Linear following of the finger.
• Value < 1.0: Enables non-linear resistance (rubber band effect) — the further you pull, the stronger the resistance.
Spring stiffness constant (k).\n\nDetermines the force returning the list to its original position. Affects the oscillation frequency during bounce.
Damping ratio (ζ).\n\nDissipates spring energy. Determines how quickly oscillations settle after releasing the finger or hitting a boundary.

Incoming velocity multiplier during onAbsorb (inertial impact).

Increases bounce amplitude during rapid scrolling.
Note: At high values (>1.0), the code dynamically reduces spring stiffness to make the impact feel "softer".
Exponent power for the resistance formula.\n\nWorks only if Pull Coefficient < 1.0. Defines the steepness of force increase when pulling the edge.

Changes ScaleY of the RenderNode content vertically.

• Shrink: flattens content on impact.
• Grow: elongates content (rubber effect).
Changes the overall scale (ScaleX and ScaleY) of the entire container.\n\nCreates a zoom in/out effect when interacting with the boundary.
Changes ScaleX along the width.\n\nAllows for a "barrel" or narrowing effect when stretching.
Coefficient of displacement influence on scale. Higher values mean stronger distortion for the same displacement.
Hard distortion limit (min/max scale) to prevent visual artifacts during strong pulls.
Pivot coordinate for scaling (0.0 - 1.0). 0.5 is center.
Spring cutoff velocity threshold.\n\nDetermines when physics calculations are forcibly stopped. If spring velocity falls below this value, animation ends. Helps remove micro-jitter at the end.

Amplitude cutoff threshold.\n\nIf residual displacement (in pixels) becomes less than this value, animation is considered complete. Increasing this makes the return to zero visually sharper and faster.

Automatically mirrors anchor coordinates when interacting with the right or bottom edge.

• ON: Coordinate 0.0 always means "the edge being pulled".
• OFF: Coordinates are absolute (0.0 is always left/top, 1.0 is always right/bottom), regardless of swipe direction.
Scaling point along the main axis (scroll direction) for horizontal lists.\n\nDetermines which part of the screen width is primarily distorted during pull.
Scaling point along the cross axis (height) for horizontal lists.\n\nAllows shifting the center of the effect up or down relative to the list center.
Determines effect strength exclusively for horizontal lists (LazyRow, ViewPager). Allows tuning behavior separately from vertical scrolling.
Low-pass filter for finger coordinates in onPull.\n\nSmoothes sensor noise before passing data to the physics model. High values make the reaction feel "viscous".
Interpolation speed (LERP) during direct interaction (onPull).\n\nDetermines how fast the visual catches up to the finger while the spring is NOT running (disabled). Lower = smoother, but with lag.
Interpolation speed (LERP) during active animation (onRelease/onAbsorb).\n\nDetermines movement smoothness when the physics model is running (spring active).

Normalization coefficient for Jetpack Compose.\n\nCompose passes scroll deltas in different units or aggregates them differently. This divider reduces incoming onPull values to align physics with the View system.

Unlike Qualcomm chips, heat management in Google Tensor is handled via configuration files (thermal_info_config.json) rather than direct kernel parameters.

This module works at the system level: it changes a specific property (prop) that forces the Thermal HAL service to load an alternative configuration file with different throttling thresholds.

This is a safe, "native" adjustment method provided by Pixel architecture. A reboot is required to apply changes.
Standard factory limits. Ensures maximum safety and battery lifespan.
Slight threshold increase (+5°C). Helps avoid charging slowdowns during moderate heating.
Balanced profile (+9°C). Compromise between charging speed and body heat.
WARNING: High limits (+15°C). Noticeable heating possible during fast charging. Accelerates battery chemistry wear.
DANGER: Almost complete disablement of thermal protection (+90°C). High risk of battery swelling and device damage.
Standard algorithm. Aggressive frequency reduction (throttling) to keep the body temperature low.
Soft profile (+5°C). Allows the processor to maintain high frequencies longer under load.
Optimal for gaming (+9°C). Significantly reduces FPS drops; device will be warm.
Maximum performance (+15°C). Device may become hot to the touch. Recommended only for short-term tasks.
EXTREME: Throttling disabled. Processor will heat up until emergency power shutdown. Benchmarks only.
New thermal profile selected.\n\nThe Thermal HAL service will read new settings only on the next system boot. Reboot device now?

WARNING: You selected an aggressive thermal mode!

This may lead to severe overheating and accelerated component degradation.

A reboot is required to apply settings.
These settings forcibly activate Carrier Config capabilities. By default, most of these features are hidden or disabled for uncertified regions.\n\nAirplane Mode toggle is required to apply changes.
These settings forcibly activate Carrier Config capabilities. By default, most of these features are hidden or disabled for uncertified regions.\n\nAirplane Mode toggle is required to apply changes.

Forcibly enables VoLTE support in carrier configuration.\n\nAllows making voice calls over 4G/LTE network without switching to 3G/2G. Ensures fast connection, HD sound quality, and simultaneous internet usage during calls. Fixes missing VoLTE toggle in settings.

Forcibly enables Wi-Fi Calling support.\n\nAllows phone to register in carrier IMS network via any available Wi-Fi. Indispensable in places with poor cellular reception (basements, thick walls) but internet access. Activates hidden "Wi-Fi Calling" menu.
Enables native video calling support via carrier.\n\nThis is built-in dialer video function (not via messengers, but standard IR.94 protocol). Works if carrier supports Video over LTE.

Backup calling technology via another SIM.\n\nAllows using internet traffic of the second SIM to register IMS services for the first SIM. Useful when the main SIM lost network (e.g., roaming or dead zone) but the second SIM has internet access.

Voice over New Radio. Voice calls in pure 5G networks (Standalone).\n\nThe most modern voice transmission standard. Ensures ultra-low latency and better quality than VoLTE. Works only in 5G SA networks and requires Android 14+.

Removes software 5G block from configuration side.\n\nMany carriers block 5G access for Pixel devices not in their "whitelist", even if hardware support exists. This switch forcibly adds NR NSA and SA bands to the allowed list.

Modifies signal level thresholds (RSRP) for network switching.\n\nLowers signal quality requirements for showing 5G icon and staying in 5G network. Helps if phone drops to 4G/LTE too eagerly even when 5G is available.

Supplementary service management via IMS.\n\nAllows configuring call forwarding, call waiting, and caller ID via phone settings menu using IP channel instead of obsolete USSD codes. Fixes "Network or SIM card error" when trying to access call settings in LTE-only networks.

Forcibly enables the built-in search interface in Pixel Launcher.\n\nGoogle often changes search behavior on "server-side", replacing fast local search with slow Google App launch. This option fixes the \'device_config\' flag, restoring fast app and contact search.
Если вам нравится этот модуль и вы хотите поддержать его дальнейшую разработку, вы можете сделать это на Boosty.
Добавляет кнопку закрытия всех приложений в меню многозадачности (Recents).\n\nПоддерживает несколько режимов отображения для интеграции в стандартный интерфейс.
Регулирует вертикальное положение плавающей кнопки. Значение — множитель стандартного отступа.
Xposed hook for SystemUI.\n\nIntercepts sensor events in DozeTriggers class and emulates wake-up, as hardware support on Pixel is often disabled or limited.
Native System Integration.\n\nUses built-in firmware code to process touch events in Doze mode, ensuring wake-up without third-party hooks.

This is Software Emulation, not a hardware kernel feature.

Mechanism:
System keeps digitizer active in AOD/Doze mode and analyzes touches.

Important:
• Small delay is possible due to software processing.
• May slightly affect battery drain (Deep Sleep).
Maximum time between two touches (in ms) to register as a double tap.
Xposed hook for Pixel Launcher.\n\nIntercepts \'onTouchEvent\' in launcher Workspace class, allowing screen lock by tapping on empty space.

Native Injection.\n\nUses modified framework to register \'ActivityLifecycleCallbacks\' in Launcher3 process. Upon activity start, automatically finds root Workspace view and attaches custom \'OnTouchListener\'. Works without Xposed and doesn\'t require root for the launcher itself.

Allows turning off screen by double tapping empty desktop area.

Limitations:
• Works only in Pixel Launcher.
• Does not trigger on widgets or icons.
• May conflict with swipes if "Slop" is set too aggressively.
Maximum distance (in pixels) finger can move between taps. Decrease if taps are often recognized as swipes.
Application requires Superuser rights (Root) and active Xposed Framework.\n\nPlease install Magisk/KernelSU and grant permissions.
Enables customization of the home screen grid columns and rows.
Number of columns on the home screen.
Number of rows on the home screen.
Hides icon labels on the home screen.
Enables customization of the app drawer grid and layout.
Number of columns in the app drawer.
Adjusts the vertical spacing between rows in the app drawer (100% is standard).
Hides icon labels in the app drawer.
Number of columns for search results and suggestions in the app drawer.
Master switch for all dock and search bar modifications below.
Hides the search widget at the bottom.
Hides the bottom dock (hotseat) icons area.
Adjusts the bottom padding for the workspace grid icons.
Adjusts the vertical position of dock icons (+/-).
Adjusts the vertical position of the search widget (+/-).
Adjusts the vertical position of the page indicator dots.
Disables the -1 screen (Google Discover/Feed) on the home screen.
